definition[0]: to completely cover the whole surface of something with something else, often in a way that seems unnecessary or unpleasant
definition[1]: to kill someone by putting something over their face to stop them breathing
example[1]: A teenage mother was accused of smothering her 3-month-old daughter.
definition[2]: to stop yourself from showing your feelings or from doing an action
example[2]: The girls tried to smother their giggles.
definition[3]: to give someone so much love and attention that they feel as if they are not free and become unhappy
example[3]: I don’t want him to feel smothered.
definition[4]: to make a fire stop burning by preventing air from reaching it
example[4]: We used a wet towel to smother the fire.
definition[5]: to get rid of anyone who opposes you – used to show disapproval
